creator: unny@rz.uni-karlsruhe.de
text:
We use ANTLR with nested inherited
grammars. This requires specifying the glib option with _multiple_ files,
semicolon-separated. Unfortunately the current ANTLR task checks if
the glib parameter is a valid file (which it is not, it's a list!) and
exits.

There is no need for ant to check this, just let ANTLR do the job.

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
Vladimir, could you please tell me if there is any point in checking the super 
grammar for existence ?

creator: unny@rz.uni-karlsruhe.de
text:
None I can think of. If a super grammar is incorrectly specified ANTLR would
exit with an error message and a non-zero exit code thus also bringing the ant
process to a halt. Performing the check in ant is (useless) functionality
duplication.
